statement: Evidence consistency across runs can be preserved by keeping experiment-level evidence binding while allowing run-level evidence_cap to decide how many bound items are used.
rationale: Evidence is frozen via experiment_evidence derived from a batch; run-level caps can operate on that frozen set if binding is unchanged.
keyAssumptions: Binding can remain experiment-scoped without requiring per-run evidence subsets.
validationCriteria: Confirm scoring reads experiment_evidence only; introduce run-level cap without altering bound set.
critiquePoints: Per-run caps may need per-run evidence subsets for fairness or logging.
questions: Should runs ever re-slice evidence for different caps, or must cap be enforced at bind time?
